p: Plant description: Clitoria ternatea ( C. ternatea) is a perennial tropical climber herb with slender downy stem, found throughout the tropical regions of India, growing wild and in gardens, bearing white or blue flowers. C. ternatea belongs to family Fabaceae commonly called “butterfly”. It is a commonly used Ayurvedic medicine. C. ternatea is called Aparajit (Hindi), Aparajita (Bengali) and Kakkattan in Indian traditional medicine [ 138]. The extracts of C. ternatea have been used in Ayurveda, as an ingredient in “Medhya rasayana”.
